page.title: 08BRIDGEWATER HOMES
page.content: {BRIDGEWATER ESTATES }CHOSE THIS AREA FOR THE {TRENT HOUSE }BECAUSE THEY OWN THE MAJORITY OF THE LAND. IT SEEMED RIGHT TO MAKE USE OF THE LAST PIECE OF SPARE GROUND FOR BUILDING. SCHOOL, BUS ROUTES AND SHOPS ARE ALL IMPORTANT FACTORS THAT HELP BRIDGEWATER ESTATES TO DECIDE WHERE THEIR HOUSES SHOULD BE BUILT. THEY DO THE MARKET RESEARCH BEFORE DECIDING WHAT TO BUILD. 20 YEARS AGO {TYLDESLEY }WAS A {MINING {AREA. }BEFORE THEY CAN DO ANYTHING THEY HAVE TO DO A {MINING SURVEY}OF THE LAND TO ASSESS THE SAFETY OF THE AREA .THE ACREAGE OF THE {HENFOLD {HOUSING ESTATE}IS 22 ACRES. DURING 1985 BUILDING HAS BEEN EXTENDED AND THEY ARE TRYING TO JOIN{STOUR ROAD {AND BODMIN ROAD}TOGETHER. NOWADAYS 3 AND 4 BEDROOMED FAMILY HOUSES ARE BEING BUILT HERE.
